projects.title: RedShield (pro)
projects.description:
Not my own project: I was working as a Software Engineer at RedShield for a year and half.
RedShield is a "Shielding-with-a-service" company providing a web application firewall, vulnerability scanner and analyzer to assist IT departments ensure the security of their systems.

projects.title: Personal Stack
projects.description:
Co-owner of a dedicated server, used to manage personal services such as Gogits, Owncloud, Selfoss, Etherpad, Wallabag and websites.
Running on Debian machines whose configuration has been automated with Ansible, and using Docker containers for modularity and isolation.

projects.title: Front-end for SNCF's employees (pro)
projects.tags: project management, ruby-on-rails, front-end development (sass, coffeescript, slim), ops, communication
projects.description:
Subject of my master thesis: build a website dedicated to SNCF’s employees.
I was responsible of the whole project:
  • Tasks and planning definition, resources and skills affectation to provide this new service within six months with a three person team.
  • Communication and product launching: define and reach targets, follow the adoption and usage of the product.
  • Integration within the existing information system: shared databases services management, web server deployment.
  • Quality management by software testing using Rspec and Capybara.
  • Git and Capistrano for code management and automated deployment.
Back-end was written in Ruby-On-Rails. Front-end used Slim, SASS and CoffeeScript.
The application was served by Nginx and Unicorn on an Ubuntu server. The database was PostgreSQL.

projects.title: xaviermaso.com
projects.description:
The gorgeous website you are looking at right now.
Front-end written in Elm, back-end powered by ExpressJS.

projects.title: MeuhOnAir
projects.description:
Fan of RadioMeuh.com (French webradio), I made a Mastodon live stream of their playlist.
It's Python code scrapping their playlist, comparing to what has already been published thanks to a Redis store, then calling the Mastodon API to toot what's necessary. Everything scheduled from Heroku.

projects.title: Alfred
projects.description:
My very own "personal assistant". Even though I have great plans for him, this project is abandonned (for now...).
Triggered by a text that I send to him (well, I got rid of my smartphone), all it does is scrapping my University schedule (from Autumn 2018), recognize my lectures, and send me a text back to inform me at which time and where the next one will happen.
This project involve a bit of web scrapping, interacting with the Twilio api. It is written in Ruby and running on Heroku.

projects.title: OwaspTopTen
projects.description:
Challenge from "Nuit De L’Info" to develop an app vulnerable to the 2017 OWASP Top 10.
With a team of 3 students, working a couple of hours, we developped a vulnerable app containing 10 web pages each aiming to demonstrate one of the 2017 Owasp Top Ten point. Three were fully integrated, one was in progress.
It has been implemented using Flask (a Python web microframework).

projects.title: LibraryBox
projects.description:
Development of a clear an good looking web interface for LibraryBoxes.
Project done in AngularJS, used Bower for libraries management and Gulp as build system.

projects.title: CarrotMob France
projects.tags: nodejs stack (sailsjs, grunt, bower), associative entrepreneurship
projects.description:
Carrotmob France was a French non profit association organizing buycotts events to reward business’s commitment to making responsible social, economic and environmental changes.
We were about ten persons organized to work remotely and following the Scrum method using Trello, Hangout, Skype and Github.
I participated building the web-app, which front and back-end were using SailsJS, Bower, Jade and Grunt tasks.

projects.title: Wheredrop
projects.description:
Lead by Gironde communities (AEC, CUB and CG33), a team of seven volunteers gathered to establish a web service which Gironde’s citizens could use to search and find places to throw their waste.
The application was developed with AngularJS and served by Ruby, and is (sadly) not online anymore.

projects.title: BeMyDiary
projects.description:
First prize awarded in Gironde in a 48 hours hackaton with the following constraint: use open data to highlight and promote tourism of our region (Aquitaine).
Organizing a team of six people, web and mobile development and finally presentating the project in front of a jury and public.
